intro: Rubus arduennensis var. patulus, commonly known as the Patulous blackberry, is a variant of the Rubus genus native to specific regions of Europe. It is a shrub characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland edges or disturbed soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species.
